Tasks.Task Description: Gather detailed requirements for secure remote access to virtual machines, including bandwidth, latency, and redundancy needs. Identify the virtual networks and VMs that will use Azure Bastion.
Design the network architecture, including the placement of Azure Bastion within the virtual network and integration with existing on-premises and Azure networks.
Set up a virtual network with the required subnets and address space. Ensure the subnet for Azure Bastion is named 'AzureBastionSubnet' and meets the size requirements.
Deploy Azure Bastion in the designated virtual network using the Azure portal, CLI, or PowerShell. Ensure proper configuration of the Bastion host.
Set up Network Security Groups (NSGs) and firewall rules to allow necessary traffic for Azure Bastion. Ensure proper segmentation and security of the virtual network.
Enable security features such as encryption for data in transit and Azure Bastion's native security capabilities. Ensure compliance with organizational security policies.
Perform thorough testing of Azure Bastion connectivity to virtual machines. Validate secure access and ensure there are no connectivity issues.
Set up monitoring and alerting using Azure Monitor and Network Watcher. Configure alerts for Bastion host status and performance metrics.
Document the Azure Bastion setup, including network architecture, configurations, and operational procedures. Share documentation with the operations team.
Provide training sessions for the operations team on managing and troubleshooting Azure Bastion. Include best practices for secure remote access.
Conduct regular audits to ensure Azure Bastion configurations meet security and compliance requirements. Update configurations as needed.
